text:
This is a 53 year old female with a hx of alcoholism and binge drinking
   since her teenage years who presents with liver failure. She initially
   presented to [**Hospital1 **] from [**10-31**] to [**11-4**] with jaundice, and found to have a
   Bili of 30 and an INR of 2.3. During that admission she also developed
   mild ARF, Cr. to 1.4, but it improved to 1.1 at the time of discharge.
   She was also noted to have a leukocytosis of 16.7 but only small
   ascites on ultrasound, not tapped. She was evaluated for other forms of
   liver disease which was negative, including negative hepatitis viral
   serologies, negative [**Doctor First Name **], and a ceruloplasmin of 29. It was thought to
   be alcoholic hepatitis and she was started on 40mg PO steroids starting
   [**11-1**]. She was seen in follow up by Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 4138**], GI, and she was
   feeling "miserable" with decreased PO intake. On labs drawn then, her
   bili had worsened to 41 and her creatinine was 2.2 with a BUN of 47.
   She also had a worsened WBC count to 29K. She was readmitted to [**Hospital1 **],
   given IVF with no improvement in her renal function and poor [**Hospital1 **]. She
   is transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for further evaluation and treatment of
   hepatorenal syndrome. She underwent an abdominal ultrasound prior to
   transfer with marking for paracentesis but did not get a paracentesis.
   .
   Paracentesis  was done on [**2155-11-15**]. At that time 3L of fluid was
   removed. The fluid was + for SBP.
   On [**11-16**] she was transferred to the floor. Today she was transferred
   back to MICU 6 [**1-4**] lethargy and SOB.
   On admission the MICU 6 her RR 25-30. HR 120
s  SR.  EKG was done. I
   was told she had ekg changes. b/p 117/57.  Potassium level 2.9. KCL
   40meq 500ml was running. The plan for tonight is for her to have a CT
   of her ABD  [**1-4**] ascites, and than to have a paracentesis tonight.
   .H/O altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Patient a/ox2, but also confused. Calling out
 please help
, talking
   in her sleep. She made multiple attempts to pull out her foley, piv ,
   ect. She is encehalopathic [**1-4**] hepatic failure.
   Action:
   Soft limb restraints were applied. Ativen 1mg iv given x2.
   Response:
   When the restraints are off, she will attempt to pull lines out.
   Plan:
   She has prn  lactulouse, rifaximin. I will given her a dose of
   lactulouse.
   Renal failure/hepatic failure:
   Assessment:
   Patient [**Name (NI) **] is greater than 50ml/hr. her urine is dark [**Location (un) **] in color.
   She also has hepatic failure [**1-4**] alcoholic hepatitis. Her LFT are high.
   Her abdomen is large round, and at times she c/o pain. She has two old
   sites where she has had a paracentesis.  One of the sites is draining
   yellow fluid. The other site is draining blood in a mod amount. The
   drainage. Also when she had the paracentesis  on [**11-15**]. The fluid was
   sent for testing.
   Action:
   She went for a abdominal ct.  I placed a collection bag over the
   paricentesis site, that was draining yellow fluid. A DSD was placed
   over the site which was draining blood. CBC was drawn. The CT was
   negative for bleeding, but she has ascites.
   Response:
   She is still ozzing from both old paracentesis sites.
   Plan:
   She is going the has a paracentesis tomorrow. Also she is on vanco and
   zosyn for SBP.
   Respiratory:
   Assessment:
   Lung sounds are clear bilat. The lower right lobe has crackles. O2 sat
   96% on 3l. Ascites noted. Abd is large round.
   Action:
   CXR done.
   Response:
   No new orders
   Plan:
   Paracentesis tomorrow.
   05:00
